did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: J. H. Chappell graduated from Duke University in 1926.

The collection includes photographs, Trinity College and Duke University memorabilia, student notebooks, and other materials collected by Chappell during his years at Trinity College/Duke University. The collection ranges in date from 1922-1927, with one item dated 1967.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the University Archives to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The J. H. Chappell Collection was received by the University Archives as a gift in 2002.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accession A2002-0074 is described in this finding aid.

This finding aid is NCEAD compliant.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: John Herbert Chappell, of Durham, N.C., graduated from Duke University in 1926. He was a student during the University's transition from Trinity College. While at Duke, Chappell participated in both freshman and varsity football and baseball (lettering in baseball) and class wrestling. He was also a member of the "D" Club (for lettered athletes) and the Order of the Tombs.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Chappell's collection contains quite a bit of Trinity College related material. One box includes a couple of Trinity College banners and pennants as well as pennants believes to be associated with Trinity Park High School. Also includes are Chappell's letters he earned in athletics. Of particular note is a pennant for the Hesperian Literary Society.

Additionally, the collection includes Chappell's admission card, class schedule cards for his four years, his membership certificate for the Order of the Tombs, grade reports, event fliers and programs, atheletics memorabilia including ticket booklets and schedules,Durham-specific business cards and advertisements, student notebooks and correspondence.

There are several photographs and negatives of Trinity/Duke athletes (football, baseball and track) as well as students playing in the snow on what is now East Campus. There is a panorama from 1925 of the Duke University student body and faculty as well as of company c. 13th engineers at Ft. Humphreys, V.A. (1927) in addition to a mounted photograph of a baseball team. The players are not uniform but a few are wearing caps with a "D" on them.
The collection ranges in date from 1922-1927, with one item dated 1967.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.p: These are searchable subject entries for this collection. Performing a search on these subjects in the Duke University Libraries online catalog will bring up other related research materials.

item.corpname: Trinity College (Durham, N.C.). Hesperian Literary Society

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: The panoramic images and the mounted baseball photograph were placed in the map cabinet. The panoramics are in drawer one and the mounted baseball photograph is in drawer two.
